Mr. Graydon
J.500 Portland Avenue
st. Paul 5, Minnesota
September 27, 1952
Station WU 0 A
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydon:
Burton Paulu tells me you are looking for a replace¬
ment for Jim Miles. I should like to apply for the
position.
I have today written Seymour Siegel and Allen Miller
concerning my interest in the job, and I write you for
the same purpose.
An enclosure will serve to indicate in detail my pro¬
fessional and public service background. Including my
services without pay as an announcer for WLB (now KUOM),
the record covers twenty-six years in radio, dating from
I have had ample administrative experience both at NBC
in charge of our educational and public service staff
and at the University of Texas, with a staff of thirty.
To bring you up to date on my own personal situation,
I am now temporarily engaged as consultant on produc¬
tion of educational and industrial films for Empire
Photosound, Inc., of St. Paul. During the past summer
I served as radio director of the National Music Camp,
a post formerly occupied by Ralph Steetle, Kay Lardie,
Bill Boutwell, and others - and a very rewarding one in
terns of experience and friendly colleagues.
